sect1.title: Configuration
sect1.para: SynCE supports connecting your PocketPC device using Serial Cable, Infrared and USB.

sect2.title: Serial Cable
sect2.para: To connect your PocketPC device via a Serial Cable follow these steps:

listitem.para: Make sure you are running as the root user.
Find out the device name for your serial port:
Please drop a mail to synce-devel@lists.sourceforge.net to add the serial ports on your favorite operating system to the above list!
Run synce-serial-config with the serial port as parameter, for example ttyS0:
Time to start your connection (see )!

sect2.para: If you, out of curiosity, wants to know how this works "under the hood" you can read Connecting Linux and Windows CE via Serial and IrDA.

sect2.title: Infrared

listitem.para: Make sure you are running as the root user.
Make sure you have IrDA setup properly. On Linux, you can easily verify this by typing ifconfig and see if the irda0 interface is present. If it's not, you may want to consult some of these links:
Run synce-serial-config with the infrared port as parameter, this is probably ircomm0:
Time to start your connection (see )!

sect2.para: If you, out of curiosity, wants to know how this works "under the hood" you can read Connecting Linux and Windows CE via Serial & IrDA.

sect2.title: USB Cable
sect2.para: If you are not running Linux, please request help on the mailing list: synce-devel@lists.sourceforge.net.
To be able to use SynCE with a USB connection, you need to be running Linux kernel version 2.4.18 or later.
Are you running one of these devices?

listitem.para: Compaq/HP iPAQ (any model?)
Casio (EM500 and probably others)

sect2.para: If not, you should first patch your kernel driver.
Also, if you going to use SynCE on an SMP system you should first patch your kernel driver.
When you have fulfilled the conditons above you can follow these steps:

listitem.para: Make sure you are running as the root user.
Try to load the "ipaq" kernel module:
This should give the following message (or similar) in your logs:
listitem.screen: kernel: usbserial.c: USB Serial support registered for Compaq iPAQ kernel: ipaq.c: USB Compaq iPAQ, HP Jornada, Casio EM500 driver v0.2

listitem.para: Now connect your USB device. The following message (or similar) should appear in your logs:
kernel: usbserial.c: Compaq iPAQ converter now attached to ttyUSB0 (or usb/tts/0 for devfs)
Run synce-serial-config with your serial-over-USB port as parameter. For most systems, this is ttyUSB0:
Time to start your connection (see )!

sect2.para: If your device was not in the above list, you will unfortunately need to modify the kernel module. Please request help on the mailing list: synce-devel@lists.sourceforge.net.
